alert.note: Alert for Allen; Elk; Greenwood; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 1:46AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Elk, Wilson, Woodson, southeastern Greenwood and northwestern Allen Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 144 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Le Roy to 6 miles south of Toronto to Elk Falls. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Iola, Fredonia, Yates Center, Howard, Altoona, Toronto, Severy, Buffalo, Fall River, Neosho Falls, Benedict, Virgil, New Albany, Coyville, Buxton, Toronto Lake, Batesville, Rose, Fall River State Park and Fall River Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
